ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.section_title: Transhumance Festivals

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Transhumance, the seasonal migration of livestock to higher pastures, is a tradition that dates

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: back centuries. Although modern transportation has replaced much of the traditional

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: practice, transhumance festivals are still celebrated in many villages, particularly in Saint-

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Pétanque

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Pétanque is a popular game in the South of France, particularly in Provence. Played with

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: metal balls on a gravel surface, the objective is to throw the balls as close as possible to a

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: small wooden ball called the cochonnet. Pétanque is more than just a game; it's a social

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: friendly competition make it a beloved pastime.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: The Course Camarguaise is a traditional bullfighting sport unique to the Camargue region.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Truﬄes, often referred to as "black diamonds," are a prized delicacy in the South of France.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: The region's truﬄe season, which runs from November to March, is marked by truﬄe markets

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: tradition. The town of Richerenches hosts a truﬄe mass every January, where truﬄes are

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: blessed by the local priest.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.section_title: Pilgrimages

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: The South of France is home to several important pilgrimage sites. The town of Lourdes,

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: located in the Pyrenees, is one of the most famous, attracting millions of visitors each year.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Mary is said to have appeared to a young girl in 1858. The town of Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: is another significant pilgrimage site, particularly for the Romani community, who venerate

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: Saint Sara.

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: heritage. One of the most distinctive customs is the "13 Desserts," a feast of thirteen diﬀerent

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
ranked_sections.section_title: twelve apostles. Another tradition is the "santon" figurines, which are handcrafted clay figures

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf

ranked_sections.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
